alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, Bradford, southeastern Baker, eastern Union, Clay, western Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Macclenny to 7 miles northeast of Alachua. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Starke, Lake Butler, Keystone Heights, Raiford, Jacksonville International Arpt, Middleburg, Macclenny and Glen St. Mary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
